channel.title: Music downloading, chance of being caught?
channel.description:
Title says it all.
What are the chances of being caught downloading music illegally? Just made me wonder.. It's kind of freaky.

@zoss0 wrote:

You could just listen to the music…And use Audacity to record it. But I guess that would take to long if you want a big amount of music.

item.title: Music downloading, chance of being caught?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:27, topic:57544”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=81963.msg894821#msg894821 date=1171366341]

You really can’t get caught downloading, the music companies only go after those who share music, so just download it and don’t share it and you will be perfectly fine.

That’s really interesting. o_O
[/quote]

no its not, it makes sense…in theory…not in practice (too many and they regenerate)

cut the head off the snake the body dies…except this isnt a snake its a hydra (more heads grow back when you cut one off)[/quote]

No I mean about distributing it.

You really can’t get caught downloading, the music companies only go after those who share music, so just download it and don’t share it and you will be perfectly fine.
[/quote]

That’s really interesting. o_O[/quote]

cut the head off the snake the body dies…except this isnt a snake its a hydra (more heads grow back when you cut one off)

item.source: Music downloading, chance of being caught?

item.title: Music downloading, chance of being caught?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Pfft, American music companies are so fucking greedy. I’m sick of their shit, thinking that people actually care about a few filthy rich fuckers losses - in reality they still gain millions.

That, and I did actually read one of their sites - One of their arguments is that they’re trying to protect people from ‘inferior’ music. If you get a high enough quality mp3 file, you won’t notice the difference. Another one of their arguments is that ‘the artist loses out’. Well, most bands get most of their cash from performing live. I wonder how much of the $20 - $30 you pay for a CD here in Australia actually goes to the artist/band in royalties.

Btw, I like how they have tags.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Blackester:

and downloading the stuff isnt illegal its the distribution that is, dun worry dude

[me=Iamadam]administers intelligence pills.[/me]

It IS illegal to download ‘the stuff’. It’s just as illegal as stealing from a music store.

Read full topic

item.title: Music downloading, chance of being caught?
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

SEE WHAT WILL HAPPEN IS,

They will email your ISP, i.e:

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE----- Hash: SHA1

Australian wide ISP
based in Sydney

Re: Unauthorized Use of “MGM” (property)
Notice ID: 354677
10 Sep 2004 21:16:21 GMT

“MGM”, Inc. and its affiliated companies (collectively, “MGM”) are the exclusive owners of copyrights in motion pictures and television, including the property listed below.

It has come to our attention that Australian wide ISP is the service provider for the IP address listed below, from which unauthorized copying and distribution (downloading, uploading, file serving, file “swapping” or other similar activities) of “MGM’s” (property)(s) listed below is taking place. We believe that the Internet access of the user engaging in this infringement is provided by Australian wide ISP or a downstream service provider who purchases this connectivity from Australian wide ISP.

This unauthorized copying and distribution constitutes copyright infringement under applicable national laws and international treaties. Although various legal and equitable remedies may be available to “MGM” as a result of such infringement, “MGM” believes that the entire Internet community benefits when these matters are resolved cooperatively. We urge you to take immediate action to stop this infringing activity and inform us of the results of your actions. We appreciate your efforts toward this common goal.

Please be advised that this letter is not and is not intended to be a complete statement of the facts or law as they may pertain to this matter or of “MGM’s” positions, rights or remedies, legal or equitable, all of which are specifically reserved.

Very truly yours,

Sarah Bergman
Compliance Manager
BayTSP, Inc.
PO Box 1314
Los Gatos, CA 95031

v: 408-341-2300
f: 408-341-2399

*pgp public key is available on the key server at ldap://keyserver.pgp.com

Note: The information transmitted in this Notice is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material. Any review, reproduction, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon, this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient is prohibited. If you received this in error, please contact the sender and delete the material from all computers.
